Matthew Sykes.Action: Rolls down window and tells a derelict alien to 'Take a hike' with evident disgust.
Expresses disgust toward alien derelict and disdainfully comments on their behavior and environment.
Rolls down the car window and firmly tells a derelict alien to 'Take a hike' rather than engaging or escalating the situation.
Reacts with disgust and disdain toward alien culture and individuals, showing bias and lack of cultural sensitivity.
Notices suspicious activity using his street-cop instincts.
Immediately pulls gun and proceeds toward possible robbery without waiting for backup.
Demonstrates readiness to confront armed suspects despite uncertain backup situation.
Casually comments on protective vests being in the trunk rather than wearing them, indicating some complacency about personal safety.
Commands Tuggle to get out from danger and offers to cover him
Runs across an active firefight to assist the team
Stands behind cover, ready with gun, and shoots the human driver quickly and effectively.
Encourages Tuggle to get out from cover and offers to cover him while moving toward the getaway car under fire.
Runs across the street firing at enemies while under fire, showing proactive engagement despite limited firing lines.
Is unable to prevent Tuggle from being shot and killed, though responds quickly and appears concerned.
Fires multiple times to defend himself against the alien threat.
Swings fist to fight back when disoriented and threatened.
Gets his gun up just in time and fires accurately, knocking down the alien.
Recognizes and responds to a threatening lunge by firing additional shots to subdue the alien.
Holds onto his gun despite being tackled from above by Kipling.
Loses the gun when Kipling slams it away and is thrown down a tunnel.
Notices the exotic silver bracelet creating a clicking sound, showing observation skills.
Struggles and is dazed but fights back with a roundhouse punch to an approaching alien.
Moves aimlessly around the crime scene like a stranger at a party.
Engages in conversation with others discussing the case, showing interest in the connection to another homicide.
Calls after Jetson to get his attention about a possible connection in the case, showing engagement and proactive communication.
Does not follow up or insist when Jetson doesn't respond, suggesting a missed opportunity to assert himself in a professional situation.
Enters his untidy, poorly maintained apartment after a tiring day, indicating possible neglect of personal organization and self-care, which may reflect on his professional stamina or mindset.
Handles simultaneous tasks while listening to his daughter's voicemail, suggesting his ability to focus despite personal distractions.
Confidently challenges the progress on the case, pressing his colleagues despite their excuses.
Arrives at work after very little sleep, showing signs of fatigue and a physical toll.
Turns off answering machine and quickly removes the message tape, indicating a deliberate but somewhat rushed action.
Volunteers to work with the new detective despite grumbling and opposition from other officers.
Insists on taking a homicide case involving a Newcomer community, advocating for appropriate assignment despite resistance from superior.
Avoids direct eye contact when being scrutinized by a colleague.
Calmly confronts his partner Jetson about the importance of partnership and mutual respect, asserting his position and intentions clearly.
Demonstrates situational awareness by linking two shootings and proposing a logical approach to investigate the cases together.
Abruptly slams the car to a stop in heavy traffic, causing chaos and unsettling his partner.
Shows suspicion and curiosity about Jetson's secretive behavior, questions what is going on

Focuses on the task at hand rather than engaging socially or warmly

Questions Jetson suspiciously about his secretive conversation, showing alertness and engagement.
Remains largely oblivious to the alien language conversation until catching only snatches and needing to inquire, indicating a gap in understanding.

Explains to Jetson, in a straightforward manner, what a condom is and how it works.

Expresses discomfort with the unknown black substance but handles it carefully and socially interacts with Jetson about it.
Initially questions Jetson's approach to interview the widow alone but concedes once realizing his own lack of bedside manner.
Approaches William Harcourt with authority but without aggression, politely identifies himself and companion.
Senses something unusual about Kipling without immediate judgment or confrontation.
Approaches William Harcourt confidently in a public setting, identifies himself clearly as a Sergeant, and involves Detective Jetson in the interaction.
Does not immediately recognize Kipling due to his changed appearance despite previous encounter, indicating a slight lapse in attention to detail.
Uses a throwaway line about 'Rudyard Kipling' with dry humor.
Politely tries to get Harcourt’s attention and asks for a minute of his time.
Appears discouraged or deflated when the Mayor’s arrival interrupts and redirects the situation.
Confidently handles a powerful and unusual weapon after assessing its capabilities (Casull .454 Magnum), showing knowledge and practical understanding.
Uses nonverbal communication effectively by nodding and motioning Jetson to proceed ahead at the firing range, indicating leadership and control of the situation.
Engages in an under-the-table transaction to obtain a powerful gun, indicating resourcefulness but also a willingness to bend rules, which may negatively impact lawful competence perception.
Fires powerful handgun rounds accurately through bullet-proof vest despite recoil and injury.
Confidently enters a dangerous bar, commands attention with unhurried movements, and attempts direct confrontation.

Disengages quickly from Cassandra despite temptation, maintains focus on his objective and schedules a return to check on Strader, showing self-control and task prioritization.

Disarms Watson effectively by targeting nerve centers, subduing him quickly.
Laughs at Watson's misfortune and insults him ('you dumb son-of-a-bitch').

Tells Watson to tell his boss to call him or face repeated consequences, using crude humor but also directness and some implicit fairness.

Engages in confrontational banter with Jetson, showing assertiveness and control over the situation.
Takes a long pull on vodka alone, ignores the spoiled milk left out.
Throws some ice in a glass, pours himself a shot confidently, and drinks vodka while engaged in conversation.
Inadvertently leaves a carton of milk out of the refrigerator for two nights, resulting in spoiled milk.
Shrugs off Jetson's concern about the milk and offers the glass, showing casual or indifferent behavior.

Responds curtly and cynically to Jetson's idealistic statements about human equality and freedom.
Listens attentively and is mesmerized by Jetson opening up about deep feelings.

Listens intently and is visibly mesmerized by Jetson's heartfelt speech about equality and ideals, showing emotional intelligence and open-mindedness.

Responds cynically by saying 'I never had any ideals,' which may indicate self-awareness but also a defensive or dismissive attitude that could limit his effectiveness in dealing with complex social issues.
Laughs heartily at Jetson's joke, calls him 'You son-of-a-bitch. You're okay.' and shows a friendly, easygoing demeanor.
Suggests Jetson get some sleep, showing concern for his wellbeing.

Reassures Jetson about his marriage, maintains a relaxed, supportive attitude despite bad news, uses humor to ease tension.
